thread.title: Colorado testing new voting machines in November
thread.title_full: Colorado testing new voting machines in November

title: Colorado testing new voting machines in November
text:
Colorado testing new voting machines in November Ballots hit the mail Tuesday in many jurisdictions across Colorado. Post to Facebook Colorado testing new voting machines in November Ballots hit the mail Tuesday in many jurisdictions across Colorado.  //on9news.tv/1REPdVB   Join the Conversation To   Colorado testing new voting machines in November Associated Press, news source 8:55 a.m. MDT October 13, 2015 A voting hand. CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
DENVER (AP) - Ballots hit the mail Tuesday in many jurisdictions across Colorado. For some of those ballots, election administrators will be using new voting machines as Colorado plans a statewide upgrade. 
Eight counties will be testing one of four new machines in the off-year elections. Those are Adams, Denver, Douglas, Garfield, Gilpin, Jefferson, Mesa and Teller counties. 
Colorado Secretary of State Wayne Williams says that one of the four will likely be chosen as the new model statewide. Colorado currently has a patchwork of 10 different types of voting systems. 
The upgrade to a new statewide voting machine will cost about $10 million to $15 million, with counties picking up the cost. A voting machine will be chosen by 2016, with counties free to upgrade whenever they're ready.
